components.description: An arrow pointing to the right, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a forward icon in an email application.
components.title: Rightwards Arrow with Hook

description: An arrow pointing to the right, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a forward icon in an email application.
title: Rightwards Arrow with Hook

version.description:
Unicode 1.1 were pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by 17 years, and included many characters primarily sourced from the Zapf Dingbats font.

The following characters were added to Unicode in 1993 and many were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: An arrow pointing to the right, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a forward icon in http://emojipedia.org/rightwards-arrow-with-hook/
emoji_net_data.name: left arrow curving right

bn:00095233v: To change direction or course suddenly; to swerve.
Change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
To change one's direction of travel.

bn:00088938v: Turn on or around an axis or a center
To turn an object so that it is viewed at a different angle.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00068323n: A gesture represented by placing at least two fingers on an object and rotating your fingers in a clockwise or counterclockwise direction.
The act of rotating as if on an axis
A rotation is a circular movement of an object around a center of rotation.
A movement of an object in a circular motion
Rotation around a fixed axis is a special case of rotational motion.
The act of turning around a centre or an axis.

bn:00027355n: The management or direction of the affairs of a public or private office, business or organization.
Government, control, superintendence, physical or manual handling or guidance; act of managing by direction or regulation, or administration, as management of family, or of household, etc.
